1 /**
  2  * @namespace Strong typing for javascript
  3  */
  4 var StrongTypeCheck	= {};
  5 
  6 Object.prototype.__defineQGetter__	|| require('./queueablegettersetter.js')
  7 
  8 /**
  9  * Check type with a object setter
 10  * 
 11  * @param  {Object} baseObject the base object which contains the property
 12  * @param  {String} property   the string of the property name
 13  * @param  {Array}  types      the allows tipe
 14  */
 15 StrongTypeCheck.setter	= function(baseObject, property, types){
 16 	// check initial value
 17 	var value	= baseObject[property];
 18 	var isValid	= StrongTypeCheck.value(value, types)
 19 	console.assert(isValid, 'initial value got invalid type');
 20 	// setup the setter
 21 	baseObject.__defineQSetter__(property, function(value){
 22 		// check the value type
 23 		var isValid	= StrongTypeCheck.value(value, types);			
 24 		console.assert(isValid, 'invalid type');
 25 		// return the value
 26 		return value;
 27 	});
 28 };
 29 
 30 /**
 31  * function wrapper to check the type of function parameters and return value
 32  * @param  {Function} originalFn  the function to wrap
 33  * @param  {Array}    paramsTypes allowed types for the paramter. array with each item is the allowed types for this parameter.
 34  * @param  {Array}    returnTypes allowed types for the return value
 35  * @return {boolean}  return isValid, so true if types matche, false otherwise
 36  */
 37 StrongTypeCheck.fn	= function(originalFn, paramsTypes, returnTypes){
 38 	return function(){
 39 		// check parameters type
 40 		console.assert(arguments.length <= paramsTypes.length, 'funciton received '+arguments.length+' parameters but recevied only '+returnTypes.length+'!');
 41 		for(var i = 0; i < paramsTypes.length; i++){
 42 			var isValid	= StrongTypeCheck.value(arguments[i], paramsTypes[i]);			
 43 			console.assert(isValid, 'argument['+i+'] type is invalid. MUST be of type', paramsTypes[i], 'It is ===', arguments[i])
 44 		}
 45 		// forward the call to the original function
 46 		var result	= originalFn.apply(this, arguments);
 47 		// check the result type
 48 		var isValid	= StrongTypeCheck.value(result, returnTypes);			
 49 		console.assert(isValid, 'invalid type for returned value. MUST be of type', returnTypes, 'It is ===', result);
 50 		// return the result
 51 		return result;
 52 	}
 53 }
 54 
 55 /**
 56  * Check the type of a value
 57  * @param  {*} value the value to check
 58  * @param  {Array.<function>} types the types allowed for this variable
 59  * @return {boolean} return isValid, so true if types matche, false otherwise
 60  */
 61 StrongTypeCheck.value	= function(value, types){
 62 	// handle parameter polymorphism
 63 	if( types instanceof Array === false )	types	= [types];
 64 	// go thru each type
 65 	var result	= false;
 66 	for(var i = 0; i < types.length; i++){
 67 		var type	= types[i];
 68 		if( type === Number ){
 69 			var valid	= typeof(value) === 'number';
 70 		}else if( type === String ){
 71 			var valid	= typeof(value) === 'string';			
 72 		}else if( typeof(type) === 'string' && type.toLowerCase() === 'nonan' ){
 73 			if( value !== value )	return false;
 74 			var valid	= false;
 75 		}else {
 76 			var valid	= value instanceof type;
 77 		}
 78 		result	= result || valid;
 79 	}
 80 	// return the just computed result
 81 	return result;
 82 }
 83 
 84 // export the namespace in node.js - if running in node.js
 85 if( typeof(window) === 'undefined' )	module.exports	= StrongTypeCheck;
